name: Carrie Underwood
religion: Underwood is a devout Christian who grew up singing in her Southern Baptist Church.
politicalViews: She won't say what her political views are, but some of her actions and a bit of pigeonholing puts her in the Republican/conservative camp.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Carrie Underwood was born in Muskogee, Oklahoma and raised on a farm in Checotah, Oklahoma.

content.sourceTitle: Is Carrie Underwood a born again Christian
content.text: Underwood is quite religious. She began singing long before her triumphant  victory as a child in her local Southern Baptist Church and in Bible summer camps.

content.sourceTitle: 'Soul Surfer's' Carrie Underwood Talks About Faith
content.text: I grew up going to church camp and reading my Bible and having different faith books and movies in my life.

Now, at the height of success, Underwood regularly thanks God for her luck and inserts her faith into almost every conversation. She does blatantly Christian movies, such as , a film about a woman who lost her arm to a shark attack and used her Christian faith to get her through it. Underwood said:

content.sourceTitle: 'Soul Surfer's' Carrie Underwood Talks About Faith
content.text: I hope that it is very clear that the faith in this movie is more than an undertone, and that the reason Bethany got through everything was because of her faith in God. It's easy to have faith when things are going great and you're on top of the world. I'm winning, I'm selling, I'm on tour and this is all great! But this story is about having faith when the chips are down and how to deal with that.

Underwood cites religion as a major factor in choosing her current husband, hockey player Mike Fisher. He'll be able to do all those great things with her, such as going to church and praying and indoctrinating their children. Underwood says:

content.sourceTitle: Carrie Underwood Says Religion Sealed the Marriage Deal
content.text: Mike has improved my walk with God.
Not wise to mix country music and politics…Oh, wait…
Underwood doesn't want to give us her political opinions. She has gone so far as to condemn celebrities who are forward enough to endorse candidates or champion a political cause. She said:
There is someone I do support, but I don't support publicly. I lose all respect for celebrities when they back a candidate.
But she's a Christian country singer. Isn't it assumed she's a Republican conservative? Her song, "Undo It" has apparently become a theme song for various Republican candidates.
But that doesn't mean she agrees with their politics.

content.sourceTitle: American Idol Star Accused of "Supporting Domestic Terrorists."
content.text: But wait, Underwood is a vegetarian and a staunch supporter of animal rights and PETA–classic liberal stuff. Beyond that, she's been accused of supporting militant, terrorist animal rights activists–thought only to be completely ridiculous people.

content.sourceTitle: Brad Paisley, Carrie Underwood + More to Honor George Bush in Star-Studded 'Celebration of Service.'
content.text: Then again, she did perform at an event  former president George W. Bush, alongside other country music artists.
Put it all together, and I think she leans more towards the Republican/conservative side of the aisle.
